page.title: 11SALTBURN'S ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Around our area of Saltburn, Skelton and Marske, one sixth of the land is used for housing. About one third of the land is used for arable, beef cattle and dairy farming. There are also three separate woods, Hazel Grove, Saltburn Gill and Crow Wood, all of which are situated in steep stream valleys. The growth in the valleys are mainly broad leaved trees e.g. Oak, Sycamore, Ash and Horse Chestnut. Also dotted about here and there are Conifers such as Larch, Spruce and Pine. Coming out of Saltburn towards Skelton there are several garden nurseries and a small industrial estate. Each town is situated well above sea level with Saltburn and Marske being placed on top of the cliffs and Skelton lying inland. (E.Mulgrew,R.Snowdon.)
